item.title: Kotlin 2.1.20 Released
item.description: The Kotlin 2.1.20 release is out! This version includes performance improvements and bug fixes for Kotlin 2.1.0. Here are some highlights from this release: For the complete list of changes, refer to What‚Äôs new in Kotlin 2.1.20 or the release notes on GitHub. How to install Kotlin 2.1.20 Starting from IntelliJ IDEA 2023.3 and Android [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/kotlin/2025/03/kotlin-2-1-20-released/

item.title: TeamCity Roadmap 2025: Updating the UI, TeamCity Recipes, and Much More
item.description: This year, the TeamCity team is working on a number of new initiatives, including updating the UI, TeamCity recipes, Jenkins migration tools, and many others. Read on to learn what our focus is for 2025. Modernizing the TeamCity Enterprise interface In 2025, we‚Äôre taking a major step forward in enhancing the TeamCity experience. The modern [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2025/03/teamcity-roadmap-2025/

item.title: Using AI Agents for Notebook Debugging
item.description: Debugging computational notebooks can be quite frustrating for a variety of reasons, including issues like out-of-order cell execution, missing data files, and library conflicts. Traditional AI tools often struggle with these problems due to the interactive nature of notebooks, but at JetBrains, we are exploring new solutions. Our research team has developed a prototype of [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/03/using-ai-agents-for-notebook-debugging/

item.title: Shout-Out to Kotlin for Server-Side Content Creators!
item.description: If you‚Äôre using Kotlin for server-side development and sharing your experiences ‚Äì whether through blog posts, videos, or sample projects ‚Äì know that we see you, and we want to highlight your work! item.title: AI Code Completion: Less Is More
item.description: If you‚Äôve been following our journey, you might‚Äôve read our recent blog post on the Complete the Un-Completable: The State of AI Completion in JetBrains IDEs. From that post, you might remember this cool chart on code completions. In April, something exciting happened: our acceptance rate went up while the explicit cancel rate dropped. In [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/ai/2025/03/ai-code-completion-less-is-more/

item.title: Java 24 and IntelliJ IDEA
item.description: IntelliJ IDEA has supported Java 24 since an earlier release, with more enhancements being added in the later releases! I‚Äôm often asked, ‚ÄúWhat‚Äôs the best feature of Java 24?‚Äù My answer? Why pick just one? üôÇ Java 24 continues to enhance the language with improvements like Simple source files and instance main methods, Primitive Types [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/idea/2025/03/java-24-and-intellij-idea/

item.title: How the IntelliJ Infrastructure Team Cuts Build Execution Time by 30% With TeamCity
item.description: Introduction JetBrains is known for developing some of the world‚Äôs most popular IDEs, including IntelliJ IDEA, PyCharm, and WebStorm. Supporting this development is a dedicated infrastructure team that ensures hundreds of developers can efficiently build, test, and release these products. At the core of their workflow is TeamCity, JetBrains‚Äô own CI/CD solution, which powers build [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/teamcity/2025/03/how-intellij-uses-teamcity/

item.title: CLion 2025.1 Goes Beta With Enhanced CLion Nova, Debugger, and Embedded Development
item.description: The Beta version of CLion 2025.1 is now available with key improvements and changes announced for the upcoming release. You can download build 251.23774.112 for free from the link below, via the Toolbox App, or as a snap package if you‚Äôre using Ubuntu. item.title: Support for Game Consoles in JetBrains Rider
item.description: Big news for console game developers! As part of the 2024.3 release, JetBrains Rider added support for PlayStation¬Æ5 and Xbox consoles, allowing you to build, deploy, and debug your Unreal Engine and custom game engines directly on your preferred game consoles. Rider has excellent built-in support for working with C++, with lots of great functionality [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/dotnet/2025/03/14/support-for-game-consoles-in-jetbrains-rider/

item.title: WebStorm 2025.1 Beta Is Here With AI Enhancements, Framework Improvements, and a Better User Experience
item.description: The EAP cycle for WebStorm 2025.1 is over, and we‚Äôre excited to share what‚Äôs included in the Beta builds. DOWNLOAD WEBSTORM [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/webstorm/2025/03/webstorm-2025-1-beta/

item.title: Meet the JetBrains Team at GDC 2025
item.description: From March 17‚Äì21, 2025, the Game Developers Conference (GDC) will bring together professionals from across the game industry at the Moscone Center in San Francisco. JetBrains is excited to once again be part of this event, and we invite you to visit our booth to explore how our tools can enhance your game development workflow. [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/blog/2025/03/14/jetbrains-meets-gdc-2025/

item.title: JetBrains Xdebug Helper Browser Extension
item.description: For years, PHP developers have relied on the popular Xdebug Helper Chrome extension to simplify their debugging experience with Xdebug. Unfortunately, this extension may soon no longer be supported, potentially disrupting developers‚Äô workflows. To ensure that PHP developers can continue debugging without interruptions, we‚Äôre collaborating with Fraser Chapman on the official Xdebug Helper extension for [‚Ä¶] Link to article: https://blog.jetbrains.com/phpstorm/2025/03/jetbrains-xdebug-helper/

item.title: IntelliJ IDEA 2025.1 Beta 2 Is Here!
